tweet: Today's 1.4% gain in the S&P, with 85% of the #stocks higher, reduced its weekly loss to just 1.3%--not bad for a week that saw a major financial dislocations in #oil, horrible economic numbers out of Europe and the US, and more evidence of the mounting risk of structural damage. https://t.co/mp3AcGMwLe

A flotilla of some 24 #oil tankers waits to unload #CrudeOil, as oil companies have run out of storage facilities in the #US and across the globe. 
On Monday, #OilPrices slumped to unprecedented levels, amid a collapse in demand caused by the #coronavirus #outbreak. https://t.co/IXopWyK4uk

Mizuho's Paul Sankey predicts oil could hit -$100/bl. 
Why?

A flotilla of Saudi #oil tankers is en route to the US, with 7x the amount of oil the US typically imports in a month. 

Amidst low demand & limited storage, this Saudi "oil bomb" could send oil prices plunging, again.

Per a prior tweet,the #oil price debacle early this week was due to imbalances in both physical and financial space ... and the subsequent recovery reflected the easing of the financial imbalance. This @markets chart, showing the change in USO, shows how the oil #ETF has adapted. https://t.co/YNHjjXX6RS

#oil -- rally is holding but we're down 8 out of the last 9 weeks.  Storage swelling onshore, so exploring offshore options -- data and elements provided by @Samir_Madani with thanks! #OOTT https://t.co/IwdADrDMro

Oil-Directed rig count - Permian: 246.  This is the lowest since we had exactly the same number on Dec 9, 2016

- US: 378. This is the lowest since July 2016

-Texa: 231. This is the lowest since Aug 2016

- The decline since early March: 304
